head.title: WSO2 Governance Registry - Guide for Versioning

body.h1: WSO2 Governance Registry - Guide for Versioning
body.p: In the Governance Registry, the resources can be versioned along with its properties and associated community features. By default resources (non-collections) are auto versioned so it create a version (a checkpoint) for each update you do to that resource. You can later view a preview or restore to a previous version easily.
In the Registry Browser You can view versions of each resource, preview or restore a particular version.
Figure 1: The resources information panel (Where the create checkpoint and view versions links are shown).
You can create a checkpoint of the currently viewing resource by clicking the 'Create Checkpoint' link. It will acknowledge you when it is finished creating the checkpoint.
Figure 2: Acknowledgment after creating the checkpoint
You can view the versions of the current resources by clicking the 'View Version' link.
You can preview a version by clicking the 'Details' link for the corresponding version in the 'View Versions' page. (Shown in Figure2).
You can restore a resource to a older revision by clicking the 'Restore' link against the corresponding version in the 'View Versions' page. (Shown in Figure2).

You can configure how the versioning should behave in your governance registry. These configurations are in the registry.xml and covered in the Registry Configuration Section.
Configuring whether to version properties and community features
Configure whether the resources should be auto-versioned (which is by default turned 'On').
